question_text: A technician installs an M.2 SSD, but the system fails to detect it. The drive is known to work. What is the MOST likely cause?
answer_options: The drive uses the wrong file system
The drive is installed in a PCIe x16 slot
The M.2 slot only supports SATA, not NVMe
The motherboard only supports USB booting
correct_answer: The M.2 slot only supports SATA, not NVMe
explanation: Some M.2 slots support only SATA or only NVMe, not both. Using the wrong protocol will cause detection failure.
